catalog_info.title: Science Fiction
catalog_info.notes: This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Aesthetic and Interpretive Understanding.
catalog_info.description: High points, innovations, and explorations in science fiction as a prose genre from the late 19th century to the present: likely readings include Mark Twain, H. G. Wells, Charlotte Perkins Gilman, Robert A. Heinlein, James Tiptree, Jr. (Alice Sheldon), Octavia Butler, William Gibson, Cordwainer Smith, Richard Powers, and more. (Not a course in television or film.)
